That.... makes no sense.

Objects in starmade lose momentum when a sector is unloaded. (no players in the area = sector unloaded) NOTHING could remain in motion for 4 months. That's just impossible given the way the game works. If I did load something up when Around my base; A: It would have been on sensors. B: It would have attacked my base the first day I started it.

In addition, Rymac is the admin I spoke to before. He analyzed the wreckage around my base and mentioned none of this. He actually determined that the random pieces were spawned in by another player, but I didn't want to discus that on the forum here. I was planning to send an in-game faction email about it today... but the server's been down all day.

This makes no sense.
Apparently they were AI driven torpedoes, so it is perfectly possible that they could've kept going for 3 to 4 months. And I haven't seen the server down today yet.

I found a system with a boatload of Larimar asteroids (The kind needed for shield capacitors), and then Xacktar and I mined a bunch of them using a "feature" he found.

If you wait for a server save, then mine the asteroid and leave the sector before the next server save so that it unloads, then wait for the server to save again and warp back, the asteroids will (usually) be back. So, infinite shield asteroids! (Hopefully, we've found about ten in total and one or two have disappeared already, but the others are still there)

I constructed ~56,000 shield capacitors (I think).
